result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J Schuster was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 86 days sentence credit.
Concurrent with: Count 2, but CONSECUTIVE to Waukesha County Case 10CF1162.
The Conditions for Extended Supervision are the same as the Conditions for Probation.
Concurrent with: Count 2, but CONSECUTIVE to Waukesha County Case 10CF1162.

miscConds.notes: Restitution ($443.40) to be paid as follows:  $233.60 to Martha J., $57.46 to Roundy's Pick n Save and $152.34 to Target.  Restitution to be paid as a Condition of Probation and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines.

Court costs ($268) and DNA surcharge ($250) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No contact with victim (Martha J.) listed in the Criminal Complaint, Target and Roundy's Pick n Save.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Received and filed in court by the State.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Lucas Bennewitz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Robert J Schuster in court, in custody (Fox Lake Correctional), with attorney Joseph Smith.

Defendant enters a No Contest plea on both counts 1 & 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of both counts 1 & 2.
Repeater enhancers on both counts 1 & 2 are struck.
Counts 3, 4 & 5 are Dismissed as Read-Ins.

Court orders the following:
Count 1:
Total Prison:  4 Years
Initial Confinement:  2 Years
Extended Supervision:  2 Years
Concurrent to Count 2.
Consecutive to Waukesha County Case 10CF1162
86 Days Credit
Stayed

If Revoked:
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.


Term of Probation: 2 Years
Concurrent to Count 2.
Consecutive to Waukesha County Case 10CF1162
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Victim (Martha J.) listed in the criminal complaint, Target and Roundy's/Pick n Save.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).


RESTITUTION:  $443.40 (Breakdown:  Martha J. $233.60; Roundy's/Pick n Save $57.46 and Target $152.34 - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);
Costs:  $268
DNA Surcharge:  $250
To be paid as a Condition of Probation

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
